faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent 8% year-on-year property appreciation with established international buyer communities, excellent healthcare and educational infrastructure, and a Mediterranean climate supporting year-round residence. The region offers superior value compared to other Southern European coastal markets while maintaining equivalent amenities and lifestyle quality.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-residents require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and must navigate VAT implications on new construction, though the process is straightforward with qualified legal guidance. Property ownership provides residence permit pathways and investment security under Spanish law.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Additional costs typically include: 6-10% transfer tax (depending on autonomous community), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration fees (0.1%), and legal representation (0.5-1%). For this €589,000 property, expect approximately €50,000-€65,000 in additional acquisition costs. Ongoing annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.6% of property value.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through international banks, typically available for 60-70% of property value at competitive rates. Many lenders offer euro-denominated mortgages with 15-30 year terms. Pre-approval requires income documentation, credit assessment, and EU banking relationships, though the process is increasingly streamlined for qualified international buyers.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Benijofar is remarkably reasonable—approximately 30-40% less than Northern European equivalents. Groceries, utilities, and dining expenses are substantially lower, while healthcare and international services remain accessible. Monthly living costs for couples typically range €1,200-€2,000, substantially below comparable Mediterranean locations.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of annual sunshine, mild winters (12-17°C average), and warm summers (28-32°C average). Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring, totaling approximately 300mm annually. The microclimate in Benijofar specifically benefits from sea breezes moderating summer temperatures while protecting from harsh weather systems.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
